results.description: We will go for a 5K through the neighborhood and circle back to the taproom. The taproom will offer $1 off pints to all runners! We will start the run at 6:30 but fear not if you are late. We will have a map on the window of the route we are taking each night. (If you are late I am sure you will catch up with me pretty easily). Hope to see you there to earn our pints!
results.how_to_find_us: We will be on the patio in front of Congress Park Taproom
results.name: Earn our beers by going for a run!

venue.address_1: E. Virginia Ave. at S. Franklin St.
venue.name: Washington Park

results.description:
Please join us at Washington Park on Tuesday night for a run! All abilities are welcome and you can run your own pace and length. Like in past meetups, there is generally a mixed crowd that attends, so chances are good you'll find someone to run with.

Meetup Location and Time

We meetup near the corner of Franklin and Virginia in the parking area of the fire station at the Northeast corner of the park. We start to run promptly at 6:30 PM, so please be on time!

Running Path and Distance

We run counterclockwise on the outer gravel trail that follows the perimeter of the park, which is ~2.5 miles. The inner road is also an option at ~2.4 miles. The left lane of the inner road is the path for runners and pedestrians, and avoid the right lane which is for bikes and cars. There are options to cut across the park for a shorter distance. Please review the park map to familiarize yourself with the paths and options.

Safety means sharing the pathway

Please share the pathway since people use it in both directions. This means not taking up the entire pathway when running in a group or passing. Also, don't be too aggressive on the trail. This is your park to share.

Laps and Pace

Some people run one lap, while others run two...some people even show up early and run a pre-lap before their 2 laps. The group tends to have a wide variety of paces ranging everywhere from jackrabbit 6 minute miles to slow & steady 12 minute miles, but whatever your pace, we welcome you out.

Starting the Run

Sometimes the group is large so staggering your start is essential. If you think you're a speedy fast runner please start out first. If you're not sure, please wait.

Informal Pace Groups

We do not formally organize pace groups. If you want to run with someone, please introduce yourself on the event webpage or before the run. Generally, we follow the model that one naturally falls into a pace group. While in that pace group introduce yourself to start a conversation. Unfortunately, not everyone will find someone to run with depending on the night. People commonly run alone, but socialize before or after laps at the park and at the pub. Overall, don't be shy! Feel open to introducing yourself if you are new, and existing people please introduce yourself to start new conversations. Meetup groups are what you make of it.

We Run in Most Weather

We will run in most weather. Please use your own discretion for example avoiding running in lightning. But we have run in -10 degree temps, and rain, and snow, so expect someone to be there for the run.

Trail conditions and Gear

The trails might be clear, muddy, snowy, icy, etc., so make sure to wear the proper equipment. In icy and snowy conditions you should consider Yak Traks or Micro Spikes or a trail shoe with more traction, and in mud consider waterproof shoes. The inner road will be more clear usually than the outer trail, so that is always an option.

Depending on the weather wear the appropriate clothing and layers. In wet or cold weather, you might consider a change for after the run.

If it is dark or becomes dark during the run, it is recommended to wear a headlamp or have a small flashlight because the park lighting is not always sufficient.

Recovery after the Run (the pub visit)

After the run many of us regroup next to the fire station and then visit a pub! We run and hang around the park for about an hour, but usually in cold weather people head immediately to the pub. So, if you don't see anyone after the run, we are at the pub because we are anxious to warm-up and/or hangout.

The pub location is announced before the run. Feel free to ask anyone for directions if you are uncertain about the location. As the group has gotten bigger we have a more informal visit to the pub. We sometimes have a combined table, while other times we have multiple tables, or mingle at the bar. Nonetheless, this is a great time to meet people and hang out!

Animal Friends

Feel free to bring your dogs. Just be aware of leash laws and controlling your animal on the path, etc.

Parking

There is plenty of street parking available adjacent to the fire station/park on both sides of Franklin and east of Franklin on Virginia.

It's free...

The run has always been free, however, any donations are greatly appreciated to cover the hosting fees for the group. Or feel free to buy me a beer!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for runners in the fire station parking lot, at the NE corner of the park at Franklin and Virginia
results.name: Tuesday Night Washington Park Run

results.why: Every Wednesday at 6:30pm we meet at 26th and N. York St. in Denver. There are 3 routes for you to choose from: 2.5 miles, 3.5 miles or 5.5 miles. Afterwards those who are interested go out to eat.
results.how_to_find_us: We're the group of runners standing in the parking lot.
results.name: Run around City Park

group.name: The Denver City Park Running Club

results.description:
If you're not a morning runner, it can be tough to find the time to run on Fridays! Join us in Cheesman each Friday evening at 6:15 to squeeze-in a handful of miles between work and your weekend plans.

We follow the crushed gravel outer loop in the park for three laps. (One loop is about 1.4 miles.) We always run counterclockwise, so if you're running late you can run clockwise until you see us, then join the group for the rest of the run.

There is plenty of street parking on Williams St., and some parking within the park itself.

All paces and abilities are welcome!
results.how_to_find_us: We will be near the "Park Rules" sign, just north of the intersection of E. 8th Ave. & Williams St.
results.name: Friday 4 mile run in Cheesman Park

results.description:
KEEPING SUMMER HOURS UNTIL IT COOLS DOWN!

The calendar may say we are in mid-September but temps feel more like mid-summer as those who ran Sat at Bluff Lake can verify; so we will keep the earlier time for the next few weeks!

Please join us for a run around Cheesman Park on Saturday. We will meet on the North side of 8th Ave & Franklin in the park. Options include loops around the park (around 1.5 miles) or for a longer run, you can run West on 8th Ave to Downing then South on Downing to Wash Park & back (around 4 miles) or run around Wash Park & back (around 6 miles). Another longer option is to run North from Cheesman to City Park. Everyone runs at their own pace for an hour & we will meet back at 8th Ave & Franklin at 9am to go to brunch at Fork & Spoon - 341 E Colfax, Denver 80203 (NW corner of Logan & Colfax) forkandspoon.us. If you plan to start your run early, please post if you plan to join us for brunch so I can call ahead to reserve seating. Hope to see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at 8th & Franklin in the park
results.name: Denver Road Runners Saturday Dash & Dine

results.description: Use your walks as exercise and remember, exercise is medicine! Come walk and talk with us at beautiful Sloan's Lake Park. We'll meet on the 17th Avenue side at the picnic tables on the West side of the tennis courts. Plenty of free parking is available. Dr. Alfonsi is a Denver Health (DH) Family Medicine physician.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet on the 17th Ave. side of the park. Look for us at the picnic tables just West of the tennis courts.
results.name: Walk with a Doc - Denver Health - September 2017

results.description:
New Terrain is roping off the back driveway & expanding the stage for a party of incredible proportions!

Join us for Wanderfest, a 2.5-day extravaganza with a killer live music lineup, over 20 beers pouring, special limited beer releases, drink discounts, outdoor beer tents, a family fun zone, food trucks, a photobooth & an exclusive Lyft ride discount code to assist in your travel needs to & from the fun!

http://wanderfest2017saturday.brownpapertickets.com/

Bands:

Head for The Hills, Coral Creek, Super Majik and Masontown!

Food Trucks, Photo Booth, Family Fun!

NO DOGS PLEASE DURING THE EVENT DAYS!

http://newterrainbrewing.com/

Farm to fork cuisine from the Bistro Colorado food truck a permanent on-site food vendor with food available noon to 9pm everyday. Bistro Colorado serves up some gourmet cuisine; check out a sample of their menu here:
results.name: WanderFest at New Terrain Brewing in Golden  (Buy Own $10 Tix)

results.description:
For this volunteer opportunity, we will be working in the Food Bank warehouse helping with the distribution of food. Distribution is the area where the Food Bank needs the most help.

After working, we will find a place to if any would like to mingle and socialize.

Food Bank of the Rockies - Warehouse, 10700 E 45th Ave., Denver, CO 80239

Distribution consists of pulling and building orders from the warehouse inventory for food bank member agencies.

*This does require the ability to lift boxes and cases.

Parking: Watch for the big Food Bank of the Rockies sign and turn in our parking lot at 10700 E. 45th Ave., just north of I-70 and east of Havana, between Embassy Suites and Denver Mattress on the south side of 45th Avenue. Here’s a map of our location.Park on the east side of our building between the Volunteer Parking signs.

Doors open at 8:30 a.m. Plan to arrive 10 – 15 minutes prior to your scheduled shift start time.

Park behind the building and Near the ramp by dock door #1 on the northern end of the east side of the building, you’ll see a Volunteer/Agency entrance. Come inside and follow the yellow and black striped line on the floor to the Volunteer Area with the big purple wall. There you’ll see a table where you can sign-in and create a name tag. Have a seat and we will put you to work shortly!

How do I get there (directions)?

Our address is 10700 E 45th Ave, Denver CO 80239. You can see us from I-70 & Havana, and we are located between Embassy Suites and Denver Mattress. Follow the signs for volunteer parking on the east side of the building and enter in the door marked for volunteers!

Please arrive at least 15 minutes prior to the beginning of your shift.

What should I wear to volunteer?

Come dressed appropriately for warehouse work. This includes wearing: Closed toed shoes, (no sandals please - comfort is also important - you'll be on your feet for several hours) and shirts with sleeves (no halters or mid-drift shirts please.)

What volunteer opportunities are available?

We have opportunities in the areas of Reclamation, Distribution, Community Kitchen, Nutrition Network, and USDA (for groups 10 or larger). Please see our Volunteer page for more information on each specific opportunity.

Do I need to register in advance or can I just walk in?

We ask that you fill out the volunteer application at least two weeks in advance to ensure plenty of time for us to schedule you. If you are looking to volunteer with us during the holiday season, please contact us a few months before as it is a popular time and fills up quickly!

Where can I store personal belongings while volunteering?

We only have limited space for storing personal belongs. We recommend that you either not bring such items with you or leave them locked in the trunk of your car for safe-keeping until the end of your shift.

Youth volunteers accompanied by a parent must be 14 years or older!
results.name: Volunteer: "The Food Bank of the Rockies Warehouse" in Denver

venue.name: Levitt Pavilion at Ruby Hill Park

results.description:
Join us for one of 50 free concerts annually with local, regional, national and international acts at the Levitt Pavilion Denver.

The Levitt Pavillion is a non-profit established with the purpose of building community through music. A rich spectrum of music genres: R&B, country, rock, Latin, blues, jazz, children’s and more!Relaxed, open lawn settingLocal food vendorsState-of-the-art sound and lighting.

Easily accessible location near public transportation and bike paths

Levitt Link:

http://levittdenver.org/rules-regulations/

https://www.prekindle.com/find-tickets/id/24898848867715481

DRAGONDEER

Dragondeer is a psych-blues band from Denver, Colorado whose singular, reverb drenched take on old school blues and soul coupled with inspired improvisation has the band making fans in roots circles as well as indie clubs across Colorado and beyond.

Dragondeer recently recorded with producer Mark Howard (Bob Dylan, Willie Nelson, Tom Waits, Anders Osborne) in California's storied Topanga Canyon and will be releasing music from those sessions throughout 2017.

Dragondeer has shared the stage with Shakey Graves, Drive By Truckers, Futurebirds, The Entrance Band, The Bright Light Social Hour, Hot Buttered Rum, Murder City Devils, Anders Osborne, Jerry Joseph, Sonny Landreth, J Roddy Walston, Linda Perhacs, Jarekus Singleton, Leon Russell, Steel Pulse, and Wovenhand +

The band has performed all over the United States and abroad with performance slots at festivals including: Telluride Blues & Brews Festival, Nacarubi Music Festival in Big Sur, California, Tour De Fat, South Park Music Festival, SXSW[masked], The Denver Post Underground Music Showcase (The UMS), Jazz Aspen Snowmass Festival, T-Bois Blues Festival in Louisiana, Arise Music Festival, The 24th Annual Grolsch Blues Festival in Schöppingen, Germany, and an appearance at the legendary Red Rocks Amphitheater.

"Dragondeer is great for day drinking and fishing next to the swamp while gators sunbathe near you and your ex-boyfriend is blowing up your phone with angry texts you’re ignoring in between pulls of whiskey. It’s music for wandering down South Broadway in the summer, sticky with sweat, searching for the nearest party. Really, though, it’s bluesy and forceful, and you’ll wonder why you don’t have Dragondeer in heavy rotation after hearing Eric Halborg’s vocal chops."
-Westword

"Dragondeer delve into some swampy blues and reverb-drenched psych folk. You don't want to miss Dragondeer's cosmic blues"
- Westword

"Nestled somewhere between the quicksilver psychedelia of the '60s and bone-thumpin' blues from Mississippi's yesteryear, these Colorado cats have crafted a sound that is equal parts cosmic and grooving"
- Break Thru Radio

"To close the festival, the psychedelic blues band Dragondeer from Denver. For them also the first time in Europe and what a discovery. They have completely their own style that alternates between symphonic rockblues and psychedelics. Fantastic!! They turn the music into sound pictures, atmospheric, catchy. Very, very original. Casey Sidwell, bassist plays and grooved as if his life depends on it, he sends his bass lines to the whole band. Singer Eric Halborg has a beautiful voice and plays particularly well on the harmonica. This instrument has an important role, but does not dominate. Cole Rudy gets the most strange sounds from his electric mandolin and lap steel, plaintive and sometimes screaming. Although they occur at the end and many festival goers are tired (the festival began at 14:00), they keep everyone who hears them there till the very end. One of the most surprising bands of the entire festival. Hats off !!
- Netherlands based BluesMagazine review of the May 2015 performance at Germany's 24th Annual Grolsch Blues Festival

"This record has a great old-school feel!"
- David Gans (Musician and 30 year host of the nationally syndicated radio show The Grateful Dead Hour and co-host of Sirius-XM's Grateful Dead Channel "Tales from the Golden Road")

"Modern-edged bluesmen a la Jack White and Black Keys, this Denver-based quartet aren't interested in retreading the past; they put their own psych-folk stamp on it. "Don't That Feel Good" is a folk-blues outing with cool percussion choices that sound like spoons, shells, and tin cans. A cover of "Messin' With the Kid" spreads some psych-rock wah-pedal sauce, gobs of lead-vocal reverb and a dizzying guitar solo for a song that'd suit a Guy Ritchie trailer. "Castaway," with its husky vocal, convincingly channels a midnight hobo-camp intimacy. An excellent addition to any festival right now, it'll be interesting to see how Dragondeer builds upon its alternative "shot 'n beer (with a hit o' acid)" vision."
- Music Connection Magazine

“Don’t That Feel Good” intoxicates with reverbs that transport the listener to a funky, psychedelic bayou wonderland. The five songs overflow with a remarkable storyteller’s ability to draw a listener in, completely enraptured by the momentum of an energetic blues style."
- Telluride Daily Planet

STRANGE AMERICANS

It’s the kind of music that the Carhartt-wearing, hard-working, industrial beer-drinking, regular Americans would listen to — the ones who could end up on an episode of TV’s Dirty Jobs. It’s a little raw, a bit loud, unapologetic and honest. It’s Americana rock and roll and it’s something that Denver’s Strange Americans are crafting with both brawn and finesse, like a hot rod mechanic bringing back an old barn find.

In a sense, Strange Americans are rescuing something from the rust pile — straight-forward, no frills rock and roll, and a matching aesthetic that is heavy on songwriting and storytelling, but presented with reverb-drenched punch and passion — the way The Band or Crazy Horse would have done it.

Strange Americans have two full length records, Royal Battle (2012), and That Kind of Luster (2014), along with the 7″ Vinyl Places (2015). Borrow You, Brother is the next full length album expected in the near future and recorded with Echo Lab engineer and producer Matt Pence (Centro-matic, Justin Townes Earle).
results.how_to_find_us: Meet behind the last row of seats on the left side when facing the stage, bring chairs to sit outside if the weather is good.
results.name: FREE Concert-The Levitt Pavillion-Dragondeer with Strange Americans

results.description: Calling all women football fans!!! It's finally football season, and time for beers and football food. Rev up your metabolism before the game, and join me at Washington Park on Sundays at 9am for a free bootcamp. I will be teaching a badass, full body strength and HIIT bootcamp (for FREE) twice a month and class is limited to 15 people so sign up now! All levels welcome, and be sure to wear your football gear to represent your team.
results.how_to_find_us: By the pull-up bars near the corner of South Franklin St.and East Tennessee Ave.
results.name: Burn It Off Before Kick Off Bootcamp

results.description:
All,

As the Run & Chug Nation has expanded to 6 Cities and over 10,000 Members nationwide, we figured that it is time for all of us to meet up and do a Run & Chug together!

This year, we have decided to choose Denver as it is a great beer city and somewhat in the middle of the country! The rough itinerary is as follows:

1. Friday (9/29/2017) - Meet and Greet at Wynkoop Brewing Company [masked]th St, Denver, CO 80202) starting at 6PM.

2. Saturday (9/30/2017) - Run and Chug at Falling Rock Tap House. Meet at 12 Noon for the Run!

3. Sunday (10/1/2017) - Brunch and then back to our hometowns!

This agenda will be dialed in more as the date gets closer. Check this page for updates!

Hope you can join us!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the Running Beer Stein
results.name: Inaugural Run & Chug Nation Meetup in Denver

results.description:
Register HERE. There is a slider-bar where you select your pace so we can be put in the same heat. It really doesn't matter how fast or slow we go, I slid it to the center, and then a touch towards the running (instead of walking) side. I think it said 9:04. Select your pace around there and we can run together!

YOU GET CHOCOLATE DURING AND AFTER THE RACE!

We can meet a run a couple of times before the race too!
https://www.hotchocolate15k.com/denver
results.name: Let's Run as a Team for The Hot Chocolate 5k!

group.name: FLAUNT! Women Who Love To Dance, Work Out & Transform!

results.description:
What to Expect on Race Day

While marshmallow sweet stations are dotted along course routes and a Finisher Mug encourages the consumption of decadent fondue, don’t write the Hot Chocolate Series off as a race that’s all about the glitz. All Hot Chocolate 15k/5k events include features that cater to the seasoned runner.

• Each event is USATF sanctioned, with a course that has been certified for accuracy
• Emergency medical plans that exceed industry standards
• Preferred Start Corrals for qualified participants
• Open corral assignment based on estimated pace
• Wave starts for larger events
• B-tag chip timing system via Chronotrack
• Results posted online in real-time
• Complimentary training programs powered by McMillan Running for all registrants, formatted for individual performance goals
• Live Runner Updates deliver texts or social media posts to friends and family as runners pass points on the course
results.name: Hot Chocolate 5k (Registration Required)

group.name: Women Walking and Hiking for Weight Loss

results.why: Every Wednesday at 6:30pm we meet at 26th and N. York St. in Denver. There are 3 routes for you to choose from: 2.5 miles, 3.5 miles or 5.5 miles. Afterwards those who are interested go out to eat.
results.how_to_find_us: We're the group of runners standing in the parking lot.
results.name: Run around City Park

group.name: The Denver City Park Running Club

results.description:
SUMMER HOURS & SUBSTITUTE HOST!

Time to visit family back East & Kimberly did such a great time hosting last time at Rocky Mountain Lake Park, thought it would great to have her do a "repeat"! We will keep the earlier time for one more week because odds are always more in our favor to get seated on the patio, the earlier we arrive at Bacon Social House!

Please join us Saturday for an hour run at Rocky Mountain Lake Park; options include loops around the lake or after a loop around the lake heading West along W 48th Ave South Dr to Berkeley Lake and doing a loop around it as well. For those who are faster, you can cross Sheridan on the western side of Berkeley Lake & check out Lakeside Amusement Park. For those looking for extra miles, you can run South to 26th Ave & you can run around Sloans Lake. Everyone runs at their own pace for an hour and then we will meet back at the parking lot at 9am & go to brunch at Bacon Social House - 2434 W 44th Ave, Denver 80211 (South side of 44th between Alcott & Zuni). (baconsocialhouse.com) Lots of street parking & if you park on Alcott, you can get to entrance of Bacon Social House. Please post if you won't be at start of run but want to go to brunch so Kim can reserve seating.

Hope to see you Saturday!
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the parking lot @ W 46th Ave & Irving St
results.name: Denver Road Runners Saturday Dash & Dine

results.description:
For this volunteer opportunity, we will be working in the Food Bank warehouse helping with the distribution of food. Distribution is the area where the Food Bank needs the most help.

After working, we will find a place to if any would like to mingle and socialize.

Food Bank of the Rockies - Warehouse, 10700 E 45th Ave., Denver, CO 80239

Distribution consists of pulling and building orders from the warehouse inventory for food bank member agencies.

*This does require the ability to lift boxes and cases.

Parking: Watch for the big Food Bank of the Rockies sign and turn in our parking lot at 10700 E. 45th Ave., just north of I-70 and east of Havana, between Embassy Suites and Denver Mattress on the south side of 45th Avenue. Here’s a map of our location.Park on the east side of our building between the Volunteer Parking signs.

Doors open at 8:30 a.m. Plan to arrive 10 – 15 minutes prior to your scheduled shift start time.

Park behind the building and Near the ramp by dock door #1 on the northern end of the east side of the building, you’ll see a Volunteer/Agency entrance. Come inside and follow the yellow and black striped line on the floor to the Volunteer Area with the big purple wall. There you’ll see a table where you can sign-in and create a name tag. Have a seat and we will put you to work shortly!

How do I get there (directions)?

Our address is 10700 E 45th Ave, Denver CO 80239. You can see us from I-70 & Havana, and we are located between Embassy Suites and Denver Mattress. Follow the signs for volunteer parking on the east side of the building and enter in the door marked for volunteers!

Please arrive at least 15 minutes prior to the beginning of your shift.

What should I wear to volunteer?

Come dressed appropriately for warehouse work. This includes wearing: Closed toed shoes, (no sandals please - comfort is also important - you'll be on your feet for several hours) and shirts with sleeves (no halters or mid-drift shirts please.)

What volunteer opportunities are available?

We have opportunities in the areas of Reclamation, Distribution, Community Kitchen, Nutrition Network, and USDA (for groups 10 or larger). Please see our Volunteer page for more information on each specific opportunity.

Do I need to register in advance or can I just walk in?

We ask that you fill out the volunteer application at least two weeks in advance to ensure plenty of time for us to schedule you. If you are looking to volunteer with us during the holiday season, please contact us a few months before as it is a popular time and fills up quickly!

Where can I store personal belongings while volunteering?

We only have limited space for storing personal belongs. We recommend that you either not bring such items with you or leave them locked in the trunk of your car for safe-keeping until the end of your shift.

Youth volunteers accompanied by a parent must be 14 years or older!
results.name: Volunteer: "The Food Bank of the Rockies Warehouse" in Denver

results.description: Calling all women football fans!!! It's finally football season, and time for beers and football food. Rev up your metabolism before the game, and join me at Washington Park on Sundays at 9am for a free bootcamp. I will be teaching a badass, full body strength and HIIT bootcamp (for FREE) twice a month and class is limited to 15 people so sign up now! All levels welcome, and be sure to wear your football gear to represent your team.
results.how_to_find_us: By the pull-up bars near the corner of South Franklin St.and East Tennessee Ave.
results.name: Burn It Off Before Kick Off Bootcamp

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
